title: Unit 3 Sec 2: Support & Locomotion
description: Deep dive into fractures, joint disorders, and orthopaedic nursing care.

questions.question: Which type of fracture is characterized by the bone splintering into multiple fragments?
questions.explanation: Comminuted fractures involve the bone shattering into three or more pieces.

questions.question: In skin traction, weights should rest on the floor to ensure stability.
questions.explanation: False. Weights must hang freely at all times to provide continuous traction force.

questions.question: Review the comparison table below. Which condition is described in Column A?

richContent.content:
FeatureColumn AColumn B
OnsetSlow, progressiveAcute or Insidious
PathologyDegeneration of cartilageAutoimmune inflammation
PainWorse with activityWorse in morning/rest
JointsAsymmetricalSymmetrical

questions.explanation: Column A describes Osteoarthritis (degenerative, worse with activity). Column B describes Rheumatoid Arthritis.

questions.question: The specific type of joint found at the hip and shoulder, allowing the widest range of motion, is the ___BLANK___ joint.
questions.explanation: Ball and socket joints allow flexion, extension, abduction, adduction, and rotation.

questions.question: Which of the following are appropriate nursing interventions for a patient in a plaster cast? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Elevate the limb to reduce oedema
Check for sensation and colour changes (neurovascular check)
Apply heat to the cast to dry it faster
Instruct patient not to insert objects inside the cast

questions.explanation: Never apply external heat to dry a cast (risk of burns/cracking). Elevation and neurovascular checks are critical.
